intro: Antinoria agrostidea subsp. annua, commonly known as the annual antinoria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, pale green to brown florets that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird life.
